name: area
description: The area of the software that the issue is related. This is repo or team specific.

name: do-not-merge
description: Marks that the PR should not be merged with the given reason.

blocked.description: This PR cannot be merged because it is blocked by something else.

in-progress.description: This PR cannot be merged because further work needs to be completed on it.

name: ops
description: The ops required for the PR on merge or release. The PR will contain additional information.

ci.description: This PR requires changes to the continuous integration configuration.

bis-app-settings.description: This PR requires a bis-app-settings change on release.

db.description: This PR requires a database change on release.

wsdl.description: This PR changes the application's WSDLs and therefore requires an update to users of the WSDLs.

comms.description: This issue needs comms during the release.

manual.description: This PR requires manual ops on release

requires-monitoring.description: This PR requires monitoring on merge or release

name: priority
description: The priority of the issue. In absence an issue is considered "normal" priority.

low.description: The issue is low and does not need to be worked on soon.

urgent.description: The issue is urgent and should be worked on as a priority.

name: review
description: Requests a review on the issue or PR.

please.description: A request for an ad-hoc review.

design.description: A request for a review in the weekly code review slot.

code.description: A request for a review in the weekly design review slot.

name: size
description: The size of the work required to complete the issue. This is repo or team specific.

coffee.description: The issue can be done in the time it takes to make a coffee.

l.description: The issue looks like a sprints worth of work.

m.description: The issue looks like a half a sprints worth of work.

s.description: The issue looks like a few days work.

xl.description: The issue looks like a sprints worth of work.

xs.description: The issue looks like a few hours work.

name: status
description: The status of the work in relation to the issue.

new.description: The issue is new and is waiting to be checked.

clarify.description: The issue needs clarification before work.

waiting-for-response.description: The issue is waiting for response for clarification.

ready.description: The issue is ready for work to be started on.

up-next.description: The issue should be the next one that should have work started.

in-progress.description: The issue has work that is now in progress.

blocked.description: The issue cannot be worked on as it is blocked.

in-sprint-addition.description: The issue was added to a sprint after the sprint had started.

name: triage
description: The closure reason for the issues.

duplicate.description: The issue was closed because it's a duplicate of another issue.

non-reproducible.description: The issue was investigated could not be reproduced.

not-required.description: The issue was closed as it is no longer required

unresolved.description: The issue exists but could not or should not be resolved.

name: type
description: The type of work for the issue.

accessibility.description: The issue describes a problem specific to user accessibility.

api-change.description: The issue describes a change to an API.

bug.description: The issue describes a bug report.

dev-only.description: The issue describes a problem that only occurs in the dev environment

enhancement.description: The issue describes an enhancement that can be made to a feature.

feature.description: The issue describes a new feature or a change to a feature.

friendly.description: The issue describes a change that might be good for a new person to the repo.

gdpr.description: The issue describes a GDPR related problem in the application.

security.description: The issue describes a security flaw in the application.

performance.description: The issue describes a performance issues.

refactor.description: The issue describes an internal change in our applications to improve developer experience.

story.description: The issue describes a story which might cover multiple features.

test.description: The issue describes tests that need to be added or improved.

ux.description: The issue describes a problem with user experience.
